p: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has been shown to cause cardiac injury and cytokine storm, which may lead to cardiac arrhythmias [ 9, 10]. A study has shown that cardiac arrhythmias may occur in up to 44% of patients with severe COVID-19 [ 11], and has been associated with an increased risk of death [ 12]. This systematic review and meta-analysis aimed to evaluate the incidence of cardiac arrhythmias in patients with COVID-19 and their implications on patient prognosis.
